com.gnostice.pdfone.fonts
Class PdfFont

java.lang.Object
  com.gnostice.pdfone.fonts.PdfFont
All Implemented Interfaces:
Usable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
PdfType1PFBFont
public abstract class PdfFont
extends java.lang.Object
implements Usable, java.lang.Cloneable

This class represents a font that can be used in a PDF document.

There are several types of fonts such as Standard Type 1 and TrueType. Standard Type-1 fonts are:

  • Times
  • Helvetica
  • Courier
  • Symbol
  • ZapfDingbats

The plain, bold, italic, and bold-italic versions of these fonts are expected to be supported by all PDF applications. When non-standard fonts are used in a PDF document, then those fonts need to be available on the operating system to enable applications to correctly render text using the font. To ensure that a font is displayed correctly even when the font is not installed, the font needs to be embedded in the document. Fonts can either be full embedded or subset embedded. When a font is "full embedded," all font information is placed inside the document. With "subset embedding" information regarding only those glyphs that are actually used in the document are placed in the document.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0

Constant Field Values

FLAG_FIXEDPITCH

public static final int FLAG_FIXEDPITCH
All glyphs have the same width (as opposed to proportional or variable-pitch fonts, which have different widths).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FLAG_SERIF

public static final int FLAG_SERIF
Glyphs have serifs, which are short strokes drawn at an angle on the top and bottom of glyph stems. (Sans serif fonts do not have serifs.)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FLAG_SYMBOLIC

public static final int FLAG_SYMBOLIC
Font contains glyphs outside the Adobe standard Latin character set. This flag and the Nonsymbolic flag cannot both be set or both be clear (see below).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FLAG_SCRIPT

public static final int FLAG_SCRIPT
Glyphs resemble cursive handwriting.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FLAG_NONSYMBOLIC

public static final int FLAG_NONSYMBOLIC
Font uses the Adobe standard Latin character set or a subset of it (see below).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FLAG_ITALIC

public static final int FLAG_ITALIC
Glyphs have dominant vertical strokes that are slanted.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FLAG_ALLCAP

public static final int FLAG_ALLCAP
Font contains no lowercase letters; typically used for display purposes, such as for titles or headlines.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FLAG_SMALLCAP

public static final int FLAG_SMALLCAP
Font contains both uppercase and lowercase letters. The uppercase letters are similar to those in the regular version of the same typeface family. The glyphs for the lowercase letters have the same shapes as the corresponding uppercase letters, but they are sized and their proportions adjusted so that they have the same size and stroke weight as lowercase glyphs in the same typeface family.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FLAG_FORCEBOLD

public static final int FLAG_FORCEBOLD
The ForceBold flag determines whether bold glyphs are painted with extra pixels even at very small text sizes.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

create

public static PdfFont create(java.lang.String name,
                             int size,
                             int encoding)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             PdfException
Returns a new PdfFont object created for the specified font with specified size and character encoding.

Parameters:
name - name of the standard font or the pathname of the font file
size - (expressed in page measurement units) size of the font
encoding - constant specifying the font's character encoding
Returns:
a new PdfFont object
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
PdfException - if an illegal argument is supplied.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
PdfEncodings

Returns:

getFontBBoxRect

public PdfRect getFontBBoxRect()
Returns BBox (Bounding Box) rectangle of this font.

Returns:
BBox rectangle of this font. Note: This method returns null value when BBox is null or invalid (i.e., size != 4).

updateGlyphList

public byte[] updateGlyphList(java.lang.String text,
                              boolean throwFontGlyphNotFoundExceptionOn)
                       throws PdfException,
                              java.io.IOException
Ensures that only glyphs required to render specified text will be embedded in the document by the font.

Parameters:
text - text for which glyphs need to be embedded
throwFontGlyphNotFoundExceptionOn - whether to throw PdfFontGlyphNotFoundException when a character is not available in the font; false otherwise
Throws:
PdfException - if an illegal argument is supplied.
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

getWidth

public double getWidth(java.lang.String text,
                       int mu,
                       boolean excludeEndSpaces)
Excludes trailing white space characters in specified text based on excludeEndSpaces and returns width of resultant text in this font in specified measurement unit.

Parameters:
text - piece of text
mu - measurement unit in which the width is to be expressed
excludeEndSpaces - whether to exclude trailing white space characters
Returns:
(expressed in specified measurement unit) width of the resultant text
Since:
1.0
